{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Crewave |model=CW-1100AP/WLB |revision= |upc= |ean= |asin= |price= |est_release_date= |fcc_date=08/29/2001 |manuf_country= |manuf= |manuf_model= |manuf_rev= |availability= |type=access point |fcc_id=PFTCW-1100AP |ic_id= |pwr_v= |pwr_amp= |pwr_conn=barrel |pwr_barrel_inner= |pwr_barrel_outer= |pwr_barrel_len= |pwr_vac= |pwr_pol= |pwr_poe= |cpu1_brand=Atmel |cpu1_model=AT76C510 |cpu1_cspeed= |cpu2_brand= |cpu2_model= |cpu2_cspeed= |fla1= |fla1_brand= |fla1_model= |fla1_num= |fla2= |fla2_brand= |fla2_model= |fla2_num= |ram1= |ram1_brand= |ram1_model= |ram1_num= |ram2= |ram2_brand= |ram2_model= |ram2_num= |expansion_if_types= |expansion_pcmcia_num= |expansion_expresscard_num= |expansion_minipci_num= |expansion_minipcie_num= |expansion_usb_num= |jtag= |serial=yes |wi1_module= |wi1_module_if= |wi1_chip1_brand=Atmel |wi1_chip1_model=AT76C510 |wi1_chip2_brand=Intersil |wi1_chip2_model=HFA3861 |wi1_chip3_brand=Intersil |wi1_chip3_model=HFA3683A |wi1_802dot11_protocols=b |wi1_ant_conn= |wi1_txchains= |wi1_rxchains= |wi1_sstreams= |wi2_module= |wi2_module_if= |wi2_chip1_brand= |wi2_chip1_model= |wi2_chip2_brand= |wi2_chip2_model= |wi2_chip3_brand= |wi2_chip3_model= |wi2_802dot11_protocols= |wi2_ant_conn= |wi2_txchains= |wi2_rxchains= |wi2_sstreams= |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip1_brand= |eth_chip1_model= |eth_chip2_brand=LSI |eth_chip2_model= |eth_chip3_brand= |eth_chip3_model= |sw_cpu= |sw_brand= |sw_model= |lan_speed= |lan_ports=1 |wan_ports= |flags=schematics |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=b |default_ssid= |default_ssid_regex= |default_ip= |default_user= |default_pass= |oui=00:02:70 |oui_eth=00:02:70 |default_ch= }} "CREWAVE", "Wireless Bridge", "CW-1100AP", "Rev EB1.3", and "S/N" is silkscreened on the board by the power connector in the FCC photos.
Per the FCC manual, this device is configurable via the included software and there is no HTTP interface.
The OUI for the device is presumed to be 00:02:70 (it is in the FCC manual). :The default SSID may be '''default''', though '''test''' has a large number of uses in this OUI space.
